CatDescriptText: Bennett Kemp, 6549 Rowan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "I think that if a man and a wife, as a mother and a father, correct the kids as they see fit and maintain a good Christian home and live a Christian life, juvenile delinquency will be broken down."
TitMainTitle: Bennett Kemp standing next to Pittsburgh Courier newspaper reporter George Barbour writing on notepad, on sidewalk with truck marked Local Express in background
